abstract: BP suspended its dividend for the rest of the year because of the costs of setting up a $20 billion fund to pay for damage claims from the Gulf of Mexico oil spill. It also plans to sell about $10 billion in assets.
snippet: BP suspended its dividend for the rest of the year because of the costs of setting up a $20 billion fund to pay for damage claims from the Gulf of Mexico oil spill. It also plans to sell about $10 billion in assets.
lead_paragraph: 4:20 p.m. | Updated The New York Times’s Jackie Calmes and Helene Cooper provide more details about BP’s $20 billion claims fund.

headline.main: BP Suspends Dividend to Help Pay for Spill Claims
